intro: Cryptantha grayi var. nesiotica, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, pea-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, rounded leaves and clustered inflorescences make it a distinctive member of its genus. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
